citeinfo.origin: LA Department of Wildlife and Fisheries, Marine Fisheries Division, Coastal Ecology Section
citeinfo.title: Gulf Coast - 9 LOOP Environmental Monitoring Program

descript.abstract: The Louisiana Offshore Oil Port (LOOP) facility was built 18 miles offshore from southeast Louisiana to provide port facilities for supertankers to transfer large amounts of oil from tankers to interim storage facilities; this in turn provided linkage with other pipelines for distribution of oil to refineries.
descript.purpose: Because of the valuable resources located in this area, monitoring of animal and plant life along with selected parameters was necessary to evaluate and document impacts in this productive zone. Data from estuarine and marine samples collected by LDWF are included in this data base.
descript.supplinf: The data included in this data base is part of a larger project supervised by the Louisiana Offshore Terminal Authority (LOTA). Inquiries regarding the LOOP project as a whole should be directed to: Terry Gee, Executive Director Louisiana Offshore Terminal Authority Louisiana Department of Transportation and Development P. O. Box 94245 Baton Rouge, LA 70804 (previous geoform was 'Database')

idinfo.datacred: Louisiana Department of Wildlife and Fisheries

dataqual.complete: Data from estuarine and marine samples collected by LDWF are included in this database.

distinfo.distliab: Although these data have been processed successfully on a computer system at the U.S. Geological Survey, no warranty expressed or implied is made regarding the accuracy or utility of the data on any other system or for general or scientific purposes, nor shall the act of distribution constitute any such warranty. This disclaimer applies both to individual use of the data and aggregate use with other data. It is strongly recommended that these data are directly acquired from a U.S. Geological Survey server, and not indirectly through other sources which may have changed the data in some way. It is also strongly recommended that careful attention be paid to the contents of the metadata file associated with these data. The U.S. Geological Survey shall not be held liable for improper or incorrect use of the data described and/or contained herein.
